document.discussion_title: BEAUTY BAY’S #TheChangingFaceOfBeauty CAMPAIGN DOESN’T REFLECT A CHANGE… | S.Y.T.
document.topic_text: Featured Features News Opinion BEAUTY BAY’S #TheChangingFaceOfBeauty CAMPAIGN DOESN’T REFLECT A CHANGE… Women of colour are not represented in the mainstream media. Despite this, hashtags such as #UnfairAndLovely, #BlackOut and #BeingADarkSkinGirl have been used to start conversations about this discrimination as well as to celebrate WoC. On 19 March, Beauty Bay launched their campaign called #TheChangingFaceOfBeauty , which shows older women as well as young. Phase 3 of #TheChangingFaceOfBeauty has launched and you don't want to miss out on this: https://t.co/crlyEXrq72 pic.twitter.com/IBgf2W52Mg — BEAUTY BAY (@beautybay) April 19, 2016 Dani Nicholls, student and blogger at missionworldie was vocal on Twitter and Instagram about Beauty Bay ‘s campaign. I love BB + this campaign, yet it's horrendously unrepresentative. The not so changing face of beauty 🙈 @WOCBeautyUK https://t.co/9rpPdqLyXY — dani (@missionworldie) April 19, 2016 People have supported Nicholls’ statement. @beautybay this is no way diverse enough for the hashtag.. What about WOC and those who are very fair? Different body types and sizes? — Elishia~May (@ElishiaMay) April 19, 2016 @beautybay changing the face of beauty how? The same as all other campaigns: European features reign supreme 😒🙄 — Natalie Gbadero (@urveryOAN) April 19, 2016 @beautybay if you’re going to claim to change the face of beauty then actually do it. This pic is not diverse enough to back the hashtag — Claryssa (@ClaryssaHJ) April 19, 2016 Nicholls’ told SYT that she tweeted about the campaign as it “wasn’t representative.” The blogger wanted to find out “why it didn’t represent the faces of beauty I know and see everyday in the UK.” Beauty Bay responded to Nicholls’ remarks on Instagram. They stated that they have “love for all races” and their campaign is about “how beauty transcends all ages, races, sizes and shapes – which is why we’ve used models ranging from size 6-16 and from multiple ethnic backgrounds.”
